data.company_name: Samsung SDS Europe Ltd. German Branch (Logistics Division)
data.title: We are growing! Wanted: Assistant Accounting & Controlling (m/f/d) bei Samsung SDS in Magdeburg
data.description:
SAMSUNG SDS Smart Logistics (Teil der SAMSUNG Group) wurde 2012 gegründet und ist einer der am schnellsten wachsenden Logistikdienstleister der Welt. Als einer der innovativsten bieten wir unseren Kund:innen optimierte Lösungen sowie Consulting im Bereich Supply Chain Management auf Basis unserer hauseigenen Plattform "Cello". SAMSUNG SDS Smart Logistics ist weltweit in 40 Ländern tätig und beschäftigt mehr als 4.500 Logistikexpert:innen.

Am Standort Magdeburg ist im Jahr 2021 ein ganz neues und innovatives Lager mit ca. 80-120 Mitarbeiter:innen für Hankook entstanden. Für die Planung der Transporte von Reifen suchen wir daher ab sofort Speditionskaufleute I Disponent:innen als Koordinator:innen mit schwerpunktmäßiger Erfahrung in der Abwicklung und Planung von Straßentransporten (LKW) oder auch in der Bestandsverwaltung.

Aufgaben

You will support our Logistics Cost Control Team in administrative matters such as processing invoices and vendor registration. In addition, you will take on increasing responsibility in performing cost control activities as well as business planning and analysis to improve our logistics operations.

Key activities of the Assistant Accounting & Controlling (m/f/d) are:

  • Checking AR and AP Invoices
  • Logistics costs booking and allocation
  • Tariff master data management
  • Registration of new vendors/suppliers
  • Support month-end closing activities
  • Create standardized reports related to A/R & A/P matters that will be sent to the applicable stakeholders;
  • Analyze Logistics data (KPI’s, Trends, Actual vs. Budget, forecast)
  • Participate in projects - especially new business implementation – and provide logistics data analysis to support management decisions

Qualifikation

We are looking for an Assistant Accounting & Controlling (m/f/d) with:

  • Bachelor / Master degree (Preferably in Supply chain or Business management) or equivalent Finance education (Finanzbuchhalter)
  • Fluent in English and German (both in writing as verbally)
  • First or several years of relevant experience in Accounting/Controlling
  • Excellent financial Knowledge
  • Highly analytical and advanced user of Excel and Access
  • Problem solving skills
  • Solution-driven and getting things done mentality is strongly preferred
  • A background in Logistics is preferred as well

Benefits

  • attraktive Vergütung und 30 Urlaubstage pro Jahr
  • betriebliche Alterversorgung mit Arbeitgeberzuschuss
  • höhenverstellbare Schreibtische und moderne Büroausstattung
  • ein spannendes Arbeitsumfeld inklusive Basketballplatz und BBQ
  • Sie haben die Möglichkeit, Ihre fachlichen und persönlichen Kompetenzen weiterzuentwickeln und Ihre Ideen einzubringen und den neuen Standort mitzugestalten
  • ein wachsendes Team mit engagierten Kolleg:innen an einem der innovativsten Logistikstandorte in Deutschland freut sich auf Sie
  • kostenfreie Getränke und einiges mehr

Zeigen Sie uns Ihre Begeisterung für die Logistik, lassen Sie sich im Gegenzug von uns für die Aufgaben begeistern und finden Sie heraus, was es mit dem "Birthday Cake" auf sich hat. Bitte hinterlegen Sie unbedingt Ihren aussagekräftigen Lebenslauf mit Angabe Ihrer bisherigen Tätigkeiten. Wenn Sie uns dann noch Ihre Verfügbarkeit (Kündigungsfrist) sowie Ihre Gehaltsvorstellung mitteilen, können wir uns schnell wieder bei Ihnen melden.

Wir freuen uns sehr auf Ihre Bewerbung!

data.description:
Wir helfen unseren Kunden, jeden Tag durch innovative Produkte und Dienstleistungen ihre operativen Prozesse zu optimieren. Als führender Anbieter für standardisierte Automatisierungslösungen setzen wir auf kollaborative und Industrieroboter des Weltmarktführers FANUC.

Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt an unseren Standorten Kempten einen Automatisierungstechniker.

Aufgaben

  • Montage und initiale Programmierung unserer standardisierten Automatisierungslösungen
  • Aufbau von Schaltschränken und Verkabelung im Einklang mit den geforderten Normen
  • Ausarbeitung und Umsetzung von spezifischen Kundenwünschen in Zusammenarbeit mit der Entwicklungsabteilung
  • Erstellen und Implementieren von Programmabläufen sowie die Durchführung vorgegebener Testläufe
  • Vorbereitung der Lieferung an unsere Kunden

Qualifikation

  • Ausbildung im Bereich Mechatronik oder einer vergleichbare technische Qualifikation mit den Schwerpunkten Mechanik, Elektrotechnik oder Programmierung
  • Mindestens 2 Jahre Praxiserfahrung im Bereich Robotik oder industrieller Automatisierungstechnik und Interesse am Erlernen verschiedener Verfahren zur Roboter- und Steuerungsprogrammierung
  • Eigenverantwortliches und lösungsorientiertes Arbeiten dank pragmatischer Herangehensweise
  • Gute Deutschkenntnisse

Benefits

  • Attraktives Gehalt mit leistungsorientierter Vergütung
  • Stetige fachliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung durch internes Coaching und Schulungen bei unseren Lieferanten
  • Gleitzeit in einem schnell wachsenden Unternehmen
  • Hochmodernes Arbeitsumfeld in unserem Neubau in Kempten
  • Junges, hochmotiviertes und erfolgsorientiertes Team

Bei Fragen melden Sie sich bitte direkt unter +49 176 23327061 oder senden Sie Ihre Bewerbung an und wir melden uns zeitnah bei Ihnen für ein erstes Kennenlernen.

data.title: Venture Development Working Student - Business, Operations & Analytics
data.description:
The private and venture capital markets host trillions of euros of investment that fund massive innovations and high-impact companies around the world. Most of this still operates on manual and paper-based processes and very fragmented legacy systems.

Our mission is to be the driving transformation engine for all interactions in that industry from fundraising, communication, workflows, data processing, and systems integrations. Vestlane has already powered over 6 billion euros in investments for 5,000+ investors with 130+ funds over the last 18 months.

Aufgaben

  • Support the team in research and analysis
  • Support and initiate operations projects
  • Support us in analyzing data and preparing reports, e.g. with Excel
  • Support our Founders in preparing various analyses and documents, e.g. pitch decks
  • Support in business development and marketing activities

Qualifikation

  • You are an enrolled student preferably in the field of business, science or engineering with at least 3 semesters left to study
  • Strong interest in legal matters & financial markets
  • First experience in the areas of data modeling, presentation building, business development, and marketing
  • Excellent communication, listening, facilitation, and negotiating skills and prioritization skills
  • Ability to learn fast in multiple functional areas of business – like legal, operations, finance
  • Fluent in English and German
  • Entrepreneurial spirit
  • Self-starter mentality and eager to continuously learn & grow

Benefits

  • Work closely with the co-founders.
  • Make a true impact in the legal/regulatory technology industry.
  • Enjoy a great remote culture, which allows you to be very flexible; if you prefer to work from sunny beaches or cool mountains from time to time, feel free - be prepared to get some jealous messages from us on Slack or to receive even more awesome photos in return
  • Engaging culture with flat hierarchies where every person is valued.
  • Amazing and smart colleagues.
  • Having fun together as a company with regular team events.
  • Getting challenged and developing your professional skills by taking over responsibilities.
  • A high degree of collaboration and autonomy.

data.title: Junior PA Engineer
data.description:
Would you like to work on exciting projects? Do you enjoy new challenges? Do you want to be part of a multicultural and motivated team full of passion and team spirit?

Then LSS is the right place for you!

We are pioneering the Large Deployable Antenna Technology development in Europe aiming European and worldwide markets. As a motivated Junior PA Engineer you will be assigned tasks of different projects such as inspections, non-conformance reports, failure analysis (FMEA) that ensure the quality of the product.

Tasks

  • Contribute to technical boards relative to the execution of the projects, e.g., non-conformance reviews, failure investigations, materials, parts and processes reviews, manufacturing and test reviews, and any other project-specific reviews.
  • Support to establish and implement the standards and best practices in the field of Product Assurance & Safety (PA&S).
  • Contribute to the dissemination of the results of the activities performed and transfer of technical knowledge and lessons learned across the LSS projects.
  • Participate in periodic meetings with the PA/QA Manager.
  • Provide PA&S support to the Integration, Verification qualification and deployment activities.
  • Review test procedures and test reports and support test reviews.
  • Witness test executions and report on the status and the major issues.
  • Support configuration inspections as needed.
  • Contribute to the identification and processing of non-conformances and to the proceedings of the Projects Non-conformance Review Boards (NRB).
  • Ensure the preparation of design trade-offs, analyses and reports using RAMS (Reliability, Availability, Maintainability and Safety) data to support project decisions.
  • Conduct QA check points according to the Manufacturing Procedure/ Inspection Plan.
  • Duties may also include supporting other activities within the post holder’s field of competence.

Requirements

  • You have experience and thorough knowledge of applying the standards relating to the European space industry (ESA-ECSS, NASA, etc.) as well as experience with Space Quality Standards and their preparation and implementation.
  • You hold a Master’s degree in engineering or technical sciences is required.
  • You have at least 3 years’ experience assisting technical teams in a PA/QA Engineering capacity within the European space/aerospace industries.
  • You have Strong knowledge of Product Assurance, Safety and Quality Management disciplines
  • You are experienced in configuration management, quality auditing or assessor certification are considered assets.
  • You have experience in the technical domains covered by the position as well as in milestones reviews and internal NRBs.
  • You have excellent English skills (oral and written), German is beneficial but not necessary.
  • You have experience in mechanical design, preferably within SolidWorks.
  • You are proficient in documentation version control, design review and sign-off processes.
  • You are used to working in a fast paced, changing environment.
  • You are a self-motivated team player, flexible and willing to learn with a highly detail-oriented approach.
  • You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • You have the ability to cope well under pressure and work within tight timeframes.

Benefits

  • Flexible working hours with a core time
  • A relaxed working environment with a flat hierarchy combined with a motivated and open team
  • Casual dress code
  • Scope for individual development and growth in a growing multicultural team of discipline experts
  • A challenging, fast-paced position at the forefront of space technology
  • The opportunity to work collaboratively on multiple concurrent projects.

data.title: PA Manager
data.description:
Would you like to work on exciting projects? Do you enjoy new challenges? Do you want to be part of a multicultural and motivated team full of passion and team spirit?

Then LSS is the right place for you!

We are pioneering the Large Deployable Antenna Technology development in Europe aiming European and worldwide markets. As a motivated PA Manager you will play a key role in continuously improving the quality of our products and services and providing the highest quality standards for our customers.

Tasks

  • Develop, manage, and maintain all PA and QA processes, plans and procedures necessary for the delivery of all LSS projects.
  • Organize all roles associated to product and quality assurance within LSS, coordinate interaction between the project managers and systems engineers, and provide guidance to the team where appropriate.
  • Ensure that project activities comply with quality standards and procedures.
  • Act as a first point of contact for advice on quality plans and quality arrangements.
  • Lead and Manage Support the lead of LSS PA/QA team.
  • Assist all LSS project managers, systems engineers and work-package managers in establishing quality management arrangements at the beginning of all work-packages and maintain them through the project life-cycle.
  • Establish and maintain KPIs in line with project quality objectives.
  • Identify and drive continuous improvement opportunities within the quality management system.
  • Implement the use of quality management tools to improve processes and work closely with project managers and systems engineers to identify the root causes of problems.
  • Prepare monthly reports on quality performance of project team and supply chain, good practices, non-conformities status, trend analyses, auditing status, KPIs, and the cost of quality.
  • Conduct internal quality training/workshops with project teams to ensure implementation of QMS.
  • Report to the CEO

Requirements

  • You have a Master’s degree in Aerospace Engineering, or similar qualifications
  • You have a minimum of 5 years of professional experience in a Product Assurance role in the European Space/Aerospace industry, thus have knowledge of applying the standards relating to the European space industry (ESA, ECSS, etc.).
  • You have excellent English skills (written and oral), German is beneficial but not necessary.
  • You have experience in delivering work-packages to time and budget constraints.
  • You have strong knowledge of ISO 9001, knowledge of ISO 9100 is desirable.
  • You are experienced with Quality Management Tools and Techniques.
  • You have excellent communication skills and interpersonal skills.
  • You have the ability to work on multiple projects, to prioritize tasks and to manage your time.
  • You ideally are highly detail-oriented individual who is capable of foreseeing potential issues related to PA and QA before they occur and thus can provide a suitable solution to circumvent such issues.
  • Are a self-motivated team player, flexible and willing to learn.
  • Are able to cope well under pressure and work within tight timeframes.

Benefits

  • Flexible working hours with a core time
  • A relaxed working environment with a flat hierarchy combined with a motivated and open team
  • Casual dress code
  • Scope for individual development and growth in a growing multicultural team of discipline experts
  • A challenging, fast-paced position at the forefront of space technology
  • The opportunity to work collaboratively on multiple concurrent projects.

data.title: Telefonverkäufer (w/m/d)
data.description:
Wir sind Finanzcheck – der Online-Kreditvergleich und Go-To-Place für Kredite in Deutschland. Wir gestalten den digitalen Kreditmarkt der Zukunft und wurden 2022 als Kununu Top Arbeitgeber ausgezeichnet. Werde jetzt Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte!

Telefonverkäufer (w/m/d)

So sieht dein Team aus:

Gemeinsam mit deinen zukünftigen Kolleg*innen berätst du unsere Kund*innen rund um das Thema Konsumentenkredite und erfüllst tagtäglich ihre größten Wünsche. Bei uns erwartet dich eine offene Kultur mit flachen Hierarchien, starken Teams und genügend Raum, um dich selbst mit einbringen zu können. Wir von FINANZCHECK.de sorgen dafür, dass all unsere Mitarbeiter*innen den für sich richtigen Platz finden, denn bei uns steht der Mensch im Mittelpunkt.

Deine Rolle bei uns

  • Du bist die erste Ansprechperson für unsere Kund*innen und berätst diese telefonisch und schriftlich zu Preisvergleichen im Bereich Kredite – von der Anfrage bis hin zur Auszahlung.
  • Mit deinem Gespür und einer guten Bedarfsanalyse findest du heraus, was dein*e Kund*innen wirklich brauchen und verhilfst zum optimalen Kreditangebot.
  • Dabei trittst du als Schnittstelle zwischen den Kund*innen und den Partnerbanken auf.
  • Bei uns übernimmst du dauerhaft die Verantwortung für deine Kund*innen.

Das bringst du mit

  • Du konntest bereits erste Erfahrungen in der telefonischen Kundenberatung - idealerweise in der Finanz- oder Versicherungsbranche, gerne aber auch andere Bereiche - sammeln.
  • Du zeichnest dich durch deine schnelle Auffassungsgabe, deine vertriebliche Orientierung sowie deine gute Ausdrucksweise aus.
  • Du bringst Deutschkenntnisse auf muttersprachlichem Niveau mit.
  • Du fühlst dich im Team wohl, bist zuverlässig und arbeitest selbstständig.

Deine Vorteile bei FINANZCHECK.de

  • Ein offenes, dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld mit einem diversen und multikulturellen Team aus über 50 Nationen.
  • Wir setzen auf eine langfristige Zusammenarbeit, daher bieten wir dir einen unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag
  • Interne Karriereprogramme, Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und Sprachkurse (Deutsch & Englisch)
  • Für deine Erholung gibt es 30 Tage Urlaub, Eltern profitieren von 10-Kind Krank Tagen zusätzlich zum gesetzlichen Anspruch
  • Für deine körperliche und mentale Gesundheit gibt es Kooperationen mit Sportanbietern sowie Online-Meditationskurse
  • Wir sind CO2-neutral, unterstützen zertifizierte Klimaschutzprojekte und engagieren uns für Soziale Projekte.
  • Eine von Finanzcheck.de geförderte betrieblichen Altersvorsorge

Bei Finanzcheck.de stehen wir für Vielfalt und schaffen ein Umfeld, das eine Vielzahl von Perspektiven, Fähigkeiten und Backgrounds repräsentiert. Wir setzen uns für gleiche Beschäftigungs- und Entwicklungschancen ein, unabhängig vom Geschlecht oder der Geschlechtsidentität, Religion, Alter, sexueller Orientierung, Hautfarbe, Beeinträchtigung, Kultur oder Herkunftsland.

Kannst du dich mit unserer Kultur identifizieren? Dann werde Teil von uns! #bestesTeam

Vor deinem ersten Arbeitstag bei uns, wird dir unser People Operations Team natürlich alle wichtigen Informationen bezüglich deiner Einarbeitung zukommen lassen.

Deine Ansprechpartnerin:

FFG FINANZCHECK Finanzportale GmbH | Admiralitätstraße 60 | D-20459 Hamburg

Fatin Hamedani, Team Lead - Sales Talent Acquisition | Tel: +49 (0) 30 617 4800 52

data.title: Technical Product Manager (m/f/d)
data.description:
Our ability to make swift, confident product and business decisions is fuelled by the quality of our data. The teams in our Data Engineering group empower our colleagues and users through high-quality data and insights:

  • Our Data Platform Engineering team offers a self-service data platform to make discovering, accessing, and creating data products easy while enforcing our standards for data quality, privacy and security.

  • Our Data Enablement team empowers our colleagues to leverage tracking and analytics data to make the right decisions and create great products for our users.

Over the past 2 years, our Data Engineering teams have made great strides in applying product thinking to our data and tracking platform and worked tirelessly to build a solid foundation.
We are looking for a Technical Product Manager who is passionate about joining them in elevating the ease of use of our Data Platform and the quality of our data & insights.

At AutoScout24 we appreciate people from diverse cultural backgrounds and with different ways of being in the world. We welcome diversity as a strength.
We know that mixed teams work more successfully. Our organisation is made up of more than 50 different nationalities, all working together inclusively and respectfully.

We are looking forward to your application!

What you’ll do:

  • Be a key driver of our organisation’s move towards a data as a product & domain data ownership approach, raising the quality bar of our data and decisions.
  • Lead your teams through the entire agile product development process from discovery, ideation and prioritisation to implementation and success measurement to ensure that teams maximise value for our users and colleagues.
  • Use insights from product discovery, user feedback and industry research to continuously evolve our product vision and product roadmap.
  • Ensure alignment with our internal stakeholders on the product vision and roadmap as well as implementation timelines and dependencies.
  • Own the life-cycle management strategy for our products, including rollout strategy and Go-to-market-communication for migrations and new product/feature launches.

What you should bring:

  • 1+ year of experience as a Product Manager.

  • A user-centric approach to both data as a product and data tooling.

  • A toolkit for:

    • evidence-based and data-driven decision-making
    • exploring user problems and needs
    • understanding and prioritising product opportunities
    • testing ideas and defining and monitoring product success metrics
    • using these insights to evolve the product vision and roadmap.

  • The ability to communicate effectively with varied audiences, empathise and align with our users and stakeholders as well as the development team.

  • A basic understanding of Data Modelling, Data Engineering and Event Tracking practices to be able to discuss technical decisions with your team.

If you're interested but unsure about how your skills match our requirements, we value personality, commitment to growth, and an open mind. Feel free to get in touch and showcase your strengths.

What we offer?

We support you to make your ideas a reality. At AutoScout24 you will find:

  • A welcoming and supportive team that celebrates your shared successes.
  • Working hours as flexible as you are, including the option to work from your home office several times per week.
  • An environment in which you can drive innovative ideas forward.
  • Targeted training and workshops that support you and your development, including English or German courses.
  • Support in finding suitable childcare and emergency childcare.
  • Best-in-class IT devices.
  • 30 days holidays.
  • Sports courses, team runs, and discounts at the gym.
  • A dog-friendly office. (We like our four-legged friends – bring yours with you.)
  • An attractive salary package and a range of personal benefits, such as discounts from our partners, fresh fruit and free drinks.

Find out more here!

data.title: Working Student (Software) (f/m/d)
data.description:
OSF Digital is a leading digital transformation firm with a global footprint in 30+ countries and nearly 2000 employees. Our passion is in helping businesses leverage commerce, marketing, sales, service, analytics, loyalty, and digital experience solutions. 

For our office in Berlin, we are looking for a motivated and engaged Working Student (Software) (f/m/d).

Tasks

  • As a working student with us, you will actively take part in our team and take on your first exciting tasks in the Salesforce area.
  • You will have the chance to take part in developing Salesforce solutions, perform tests and help with data analysis.
  • We place a high value on your personal development and will give you time to complete trailhead learning modules and build your knowledge in the Salesforce space.
  • You will be able to develop a solid understanding of the Salesforce platform and develop your skills.
  • As you progress with us, you will have the opportunity to specialize in a particular area. You can either deepen your skills in software development with APEX or develop your skills in Salesforce Consulting.

Requirements

  • Ongoing studies in Informatics/Computer Science
  • Ability to independently investigate and implement solutions to complex problems
  • Must be ambitious and result-oriented with strong communications skills in English and German

Benefits

  • Up to 20 hours a week of practical work instead of pure theory: We offer you the chance to participate in relevant projects and develop your skills in your chosen area.
  • A versatile student job, with varied tasks in an innovative environment
  • Reasonable pay and flexible time management
  • International environment with the opportunity to network globally

If you have a passion for Salesforce, enjoy working as part of a team, and are ready to get actively involved, we'd love to hear from you!

data.title: Online Marketing Manager (m/f/d)
data.description:
Do you enjoy working in a fast-paced, growth-driven environment? Are you excited to contribute to the digital transformation in the car sales industry? Are you passionate about building customer-centric products for car dealers? If yes, come join us in the Online Marketing Team at AutoScout24!

AutoScout24 is a European Tech company and a leading online car marketplace with domain presence in 8 countries. Together with our agile and diverse teams, we are moving the world and connect >41,000 dealers with >15 million unique monthly visitors. We foster an environment of learning from best-in-class leaders, whereby each team member is tasked with helping to craft our dynamic, product first culture. We believe excellence is achieved when we move, work, and win as one.

At AutoScout24 we appreciate different lifestyles and cultural backgrounds. At AutoScout24 we welcome diversity as a strength. We know that mixed teams work more successfully. Our organisation is made up of more than 50+ different nationalities, all working together inclusively and respectfully.

We work in a dynamic and cross-functional environment and are looking for an enthusiastic Online Marketing Manager (m/f/d) to join our team.

If you enjoy playing an active role in the further development of our paid marketing tasks and systems, and thus effectively supporting the overarching strategy and thereby making a significant contribution to the company's success - then welcome as a Online Marketing Manager at AutoScout24!

Your role:

  • You are responsible for the strategic and operational development of our national and international online marketing accounts
  • You analyze, optimize and design best practices for our operational marketing processes, measures and tactics and thus increase our marketing efficiency
  • You have full responsibility over your channel's budget
  • You speak data and are responsible for monitoring, analysis and success monitoring
  • You drive the development of campaign concepts for new products and product groups
  • You are in intensive exchange with our partners like Facebook, Criteo or Youtube
  • You observe market trends, do competitor and benchmark analyzes and bring new impulses & trends to the team, evaluate and test new measures, partners & tools

Your success:

  • You have a degree (business administration, marketing, etc.) or a comparable education
  • You have professional experience in the digital world (2-4 years approx.)
  • You have a strong hands-on mentality - "I like to put on my overalls myself"
  • You have a strong business focus - "Marketing must have a directly measurable, positive impact on our business"
  • You are a strong communicator - "Whether developer, marketing manager or managing director: I can express myself safely in any language"
  • You are tolerant of frustration - "I don't give up so quickly even in complex structures with many stakeholders and delays"
  • You are an active designer - "If existing structures are not sufficient for my work, I would be happy to create them and make suggestions"
  • You stay curious, keep your finger on the pulse and feel comfortable in a dynamic, fast-paced work environment in which you are constantly developing
  • You have a pronounced solution orientation - "Recognize problems and concentrate on solutions for seemingly unsolvable problems"
  • You speak business fluent English , German ist very desired

What we offer you so that you can be even more successful:

We have been an agile, dynamic and above all multicultural company for 20 years. Talents can move a lot with us and create added value for our customers every day. With us you can expect:

  • An attractive salary package and a lucrative company pension scheme
  • A balanced work-life balance with flexible working hours, hybrid working mode and 30 vacation days per year
  • Personal development through individual training, language courses, workshops and seminars
  • Personal benefits, such as discounts in the gym or in the canteen
  • Fresh fruit and of course free drinks
  • We celebrate success together with: team events, summer party, Oktoberfest or Christmas party
  • Dog-friendly office and even more here...

We look forward to your online application!
